intro: Polyachyrus, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its vines can grow rapidly, reaching lengths of several meters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the flowers range in color from white to deep purple.
